rationale: Avoid ending a line with a period if the preceding bullets are sentence fragments without periods; maintain consistency in bullet/paragraph endings for internal slides.
Avoid informal abbreviations (‚Äúaka‚Äù) for clarity with a nontechnical audience and to match professional tone.
Use plain, accessible language for a nontechnical audience; ‚Äúconnector‚Äù is clearer and more direct.
Avoid special symbols in body text for accessibility and readability in presentations; AP favors words over symbols.

issue: A lot vs. LOT for emphasis

issue: Hyphenation and style of compound modifier

Use a comma in four-digit numerals per AP style.
Avoid emojis in professional internal presentations unless purposeful; maintain consistent tone.
Remove the comma before a restrictive ‚Äúbut not‚Äù for smoother flow; it‚Äôs not joining two independent clauses.
As a verb, ‚Äúset up‚Äù is two words; verify consistent use. If used as a noun or adjective, use ‚Äúsetup.‚Äù
